players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the detective.
Night 1 begins.
Charlie was found dead.
You investigated Diana and discovered that they are the mafioso.
Day 1 begins.
You: "Diana is the mafioso. I investigated her last night and confirmed she's mafia. We need to vote her out immediately."
Bob: "Alice, if you're the detective, why did you investigate Diana first night instead of someone more suspicious like Charlie? That seems odd."
Diana: "Alice is lying. I am the detective and investigated Bob last night. He is a villager. Alice must be mafia trying to frame me."

Bob: "Alice, if you're the real detective, why did you investigate Diana instead of Charlie on night one? That seems like poor detective strategy. Diana, your claim also seems weak - investigating a villager first night isn't optimal either."

Diana: "Bob, if Alice were detective, she'd have investigated Charlie first night as he was most suspicious. Instead she 'investigated' me - clearly a fake claim. I'm the real detective who investigated Bob, a villager. Alice is mafia trying to frame me..."

You: "Diana, if you're really the detective, then prove it by telling us who the mafioso is. You claim to have investigated Bob and found him innocent, but that doesn't help us find the actual mafia. I know Diana is the mafioso because..."
